alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 2:15PM PDT until March 28 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Mountain Snow Tonight and Monday... .A weather system will impact northern California tonight into Monday evening, and will bring winter weather conditions to the mountains from I-80 south. The heaviest snow will fall tonight into Monday morning with snow showers continuing the rest of the day Monday. Snow levels will fall below pass level tonight reaching 5500-6000 feet Monday morning. Motorists with travel plans are encouraged to check with CalTrans for the latest road conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Plan on slippery road conditions, including during the morning commute on Monday. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, locally higher, are expected. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada above 6000 feet. * WHEN...Midnight to 8 PM Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
